• Main Page
Examples

This directory has few examples detailing how to use the sensor API.

Please note 

- Not all features of sensor are showcased in examples
- Examples source code are optimized for demonstration rather than production use.
- For new feature request or bug report, raise request in https://community.bosch-sensortec.com

Important links

  • BMA400 product page
  • BMA400 github page
  • BMA400 accelerometer design guide
  • Knowledge base page
  • Community support page

HAL ( Hardware Abstraction Layer )

For example, HAL provides interface for HW specific interaction and initialization. bma400_hal_coines_*.c is used for communication with COINES (COmmunication with INertial and Environmental Sensors) board or extend bma400_hal_custom.c for any custom board.

Experiment with COINES

Setup

  • Install the COINES software ( which can be downloaded from https://www.bosch-sensortec.com/bst/support_tools/downloads/overview_downloads
Note : For more details regarding environment setup, please refer the document `BST-COINES-SD001.pdf` which can be found in COINES installation directory (`C:/COINES/v2.0/doc/`)
  • Set the COINES_INSTALL_PATH in the Makefile ( examples/Makefile )
  • Execute make from the root directory examples
$ cd examples
$ make EXAMPLE_FILE=../bma400_basic.c
  • Now run the example
$ ../bma400_basic.exe
